company.name: AbiSim Technologies
company.mission: Eliminate manufacturing defects through real-time causal backtrace and adaptive process control

core_technology.name: WDBX
core_technology.description: A causal inference engine that traces manufacturing anomalies back to root causes across design, process parameters, and sensor signals
core_technology.key_innovation: Integrates digital twin simulations with real-time sensor data to create weighted causal graphs, enabling deterministic root-cause analysis

ai_system.name: Abi
ai_system.description: AI-powered manufacturing optimization agent that uses WDBX for causal reasoning and recommends process parameter adjustments
capabilities: Real-time anomaly detection from sensor arrays (vision, acoustic, thermal, force)
Process parameter recommendations with confidence scores

integration.digital_twins: Maps CAD models to FEA/CFD simulations; runs 100+ parameter variations to build surrogate models
integration.lcm_integration: Connects to Lifecycle Management systems for design-to-manufacturing feedback loops
integration.edge_deployment: On-premises processing for sensitive manufacturing data with cloud-based model updates

pain_points.scrap_rate: 5-15% of parts fail first-pass inspection in precision manufacturing
pain_points.energy_waste: 20-30% energy consumption attributed to defective part rework
pain_points.root_cause_analysis: Takes 48-72 hours manual investigation per anomaly

competitive_landscape.differentiation: WDBX provides deterministic causal reasoning vs black-box ML predictions; integrates simulation + real-time data

revenue_streams.pricing: Per production line: $8k-25k/month depending on line complexity and sensor count

revenue_streams.includes: Digital twin setup, sensor integration, PLC/SCADA connectors, training

revenue_streams.pricing: Optional: 10-20% of measured savings in scrap reduction first year

unit_economics.assumptions: Average customer: 3 lines, 18-month sales cycle, 36-month retention

go_to_market.phase_1: Direct sales to tier-1 aerospace/automotive via warm intros and trade shows
go_to_market.phase_2: Partnerships with MES/PLM vendors (Siemens, Dassault) as advanced analytics module
go_to_market.phase_3: Channel through system integrators (Rockwell, ABB partners)

architecture.edge_layer: Real-time sensor processing (100Hz-10kHz sampling), local anomaly detection models
architecture.cloud_layer: WDBX causal engine, digital twin simulations, model training pipeline
architecture.data_flow: Sensor data → edge processing → anomaly flags → WDBX backtrace → Abi recommendations → human approval → actuation

ml_stack.anomaly_detection: Isolation forests, autoencoders, statistical process control
ml_stack.causal_inference: WDBX proprietary algorithm + DoWhy framework integration
ml_stack.simulation: FEA/CFD surrogates trained on 1000+ design variations per part family

defensibility.ip_strategy: Provisional patent filed on WDBX causal graph construction; planning 2 additional filings
defensibility.data_moat: Proprietary sensor-to-defect labeled datasets from pilots (10M+ data points expected year 1)
defensibility.switching_costs: Deep integration with customer PLM/MES and trained digital twins

risks_and_mitigations.risk: Pilot fails to show measurable ROI
risks_and_mitigations.mitigation: Select lines with clear baseline KPIs and high scrap rates (>5%); implement robust sensor QA; run parallel shadow mode before live recommendations; set conservative success thresholds (20% improvement)

risks_and_mitigations.risk: Safety incident from incorrect Abi recommendation
risks_and_mitigations.mitigation: Strict human-in-loop gates for all parameter changes; define safe operating bounds per process; liability insurance; emergency stop protocols; log all recommendations and approvals
Edge deployment for sensitive processing; SOC2 compliance roadmap; encryption at rest and in transit; annual penetration testing; clear data ownership contracts
Prioritize warm intros and existing pilot expansions; offer pilot-to-paid conversion incentives; success-based pricing to reduce upfront risk; target 3-6 month pilot-to-contract timeline

risks_and_mitigations.risk: Difficulty hiring specialized talent (manufacturing + ML + simulation)
risks_and_mitigations.mitigation: Competitive equity grants; highlight mission-driven work; sponsor technical contests; partner with universities (co-op programs); consider remote-first for specialized roles

senior_ml_engineer.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Manufacturing AI
responsibilities: Design and deploy time-series anomaly detection models for multi-modal sensor data
Build and maintain causal inference pipelines integrating WDBX engine
Develop sensor fusion algorithms for vision, acoustic, thermal, and force data streams
Collaborate with manufacturing engineers to tune model performance on production lines
Implement model monitoring, A/B testing, and continuous improvement frameworks
Contribute to ML infrastructure: feature stores, model registry, deployment pipelines
required_skills: 5+ years ML engineering experience, 2+ years in production systems
Deep expertise in time-series modeling (LSTM, Transformers, state-space models)
Proficiency in PyTorch or TensorFlow; Python; SQL; Git
Experience with sensor data and signal processing
Strong software engineering practices: testing, CI/CD, code review
Ability to explain complex ML concepts to non-technical stakeholders
preferred_skills: Background in manufacturing, robotics, or industrial IoT
Familiarity with PLC/SCADA systems and industrial protocols (OPC-UA, Modbus)
Experience with causal inference methods or simulation-based modeling
Knowledge of FEA/CFD or digital twin technologies
Edge ML deployment experience (ONNX, TensorRT, etc.)

compensation.benefits: Health, dental, vision insurance; 401k; flexible vacation; remote-friendly

interview_process: Stage 1: Recruiter screen (30 min) - mission fit and background
Stage 2: Take-home problem (90 min) - sensor fusion or anomaly detection challenge
Stage 3: Technical deep dive (90 min) - architecture design and ML systems discussion
Stage 4: Team pairing session (60 min) - collaborative debugging or feature implementation
sample_kpis: Model accuracy on pilot anomaly detection: >90% precision, >85% recall
Recommendation acceptance rate by manufacturing engineers: >70%
Model latency: <500ms inference time for real-time alerts
Code quality: >80% test coverage; all PRs reviewed and approved
Deployment velocity: ship model improvements every 2-4 weeks

values: Technical excellence: We solve hard problems with rigorous engineering
Customer obsession: Manufacturing engineers are our heroes; we build tools they trust
Ownership: Early team members own entire modules and see direct impact
Transparency: Open feedback, shared metrics, honest about risks and unknowns
Work-life balance: Sustainable pace; we're building for the long term

perks: Learning budget: $2k/year for courses, conferences, books
Latest hardware: MacBook Pro / Linux workstation, dual monitors
